intro: Casearia luetzelburgii, commonly known as the Luetzelburg's casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the genus Casearia. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within rainforests.
